revised_title: Further Investigations on Electro-Deposited Antimony Properties
tldr: The author, George Gore, examines the properties of electro-deposited antimony and its changes upon heating. He concludes that the substance is a weak chemical compound of antimony and acid hydrochlorate of terchloride, decomposable by heat, and that the observed changes are due to molecular alterations and partial chemical decompositions based on the temperature and discharge rate.
